snippet: Brittney Griner has said that the money she could make by turning pro can wait. But she and women’s college basketball find themselves in a complicated, conflicted situation.
abstract: Jere Longman On College Basketball column; Baylor center Brittney Griner, the dominant figure in women's college basketball whose team is heavily favored to win the NCAA national championship, has said emphatically that she will return for her senior season in 2012-13; many experts in professional basketball believe, however, that Griner has more earning power if she turns pro now.
lead_paragraph: Brittney Griner has said that the money she could make by turning pro can wait. But she and women’s college basketball find themselves in a complicated, conflicted situation.

headline.seo: Women’s College Basketball Needs Griner, But Can She Afford to Stay at Baylor?
headline.main: Senior Season Awaits, but at Potential Cost
headline.print_headline: Senior Season Awaits, but at Potential Cost
